content:
That's a great approach!

By choosing scheduled coverage for your high-value or sentimental pieces, like your engagement ring and antique brooch, you'll have the peace of mind knowing that each item is specifically protected and insured for its exact value.

For your less valuable pieces, like your silver ring with a turquoise stone, unscheduled coverage can provide a cost-effective way to protect them against loss or damage. Since these items are less valuable, the risk of loss is lower, and unscheduled coverage can provide a decent level of protection without breaking the bank.

By mixing and matching scheduled and unscheduled coverage, you can create a customized insurance plan that meets your specific needs and budget. Just remember to review and update your policy regularly to ensure that your coverage remains adequate as your collection grows or changes.

Also, don't forget to keep detailed records of your jewelry, including photos, appraisals, and receipts, to make the claims process smoother in case you need to file a claim.

You're taking a smart and thoughtful approach to protecting your jewelry collection. Kudos to you!
